com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions

Class VectorInnerProduct

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core.FactorFunction
      • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.VectorInnerProduct
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFactorFunction

    public class VectorInnerProduct
extends FactorFunction
    Deterministic vector inner product. This is a deterministic directed factor (if smoothing is not enabled). Optional smoothing may be applied, by providing a smoothing value in the constructor. If smoothing is enabled, the distribution is smoothed by exp(-difference^2/smoothing), where difference is the distance between the output value and the deterministic output value for the corresponding inputs. The variables are ordered as follows in the argument list: 1) Output value 2) First input vector (may be either a list of scalars or a RealJoint vector) 3) Second input vector (may be either a list of scalars or a RealJoint vector)
    Since:
    0.05

        public final double evalEnergy(Value[] arguments)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorFunction
        Evaluates the possibly unnormalized negative log probability density of the arguments.

        This must be equivalent to -log(IFactorFunction.eval(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[])(values)).

      • updateDeterministicLimit

        public final int updateDeterministicLimit(int numEdges)
        Description copied from class: FactorFunction
        The maximum number of variable updates beyond which FactorFunction.updateDeterministic(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[], java.util.Collection<com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.IndexedValue>, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<int[]>) should not be called.

        Default implementation returns 0, indicating that FactorFunction.updateDeterministic(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[], java.util.Collection<com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.IndexedValue>, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<int[]>) should never be called.

        Overrides:
        updateDeterministicLimit in class FactorFunction
        Parameters:
        numEdges - is the number of edges (variables) to consider. It corresponds to the size of the first argument to FactorFunction.updateDeterministic(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[], java.util.Collection<com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.IndexedValue>, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<int[]>).

      • updateDeterministic

        public final boolean updateDeterministic(Value[] values,
                          java.util.Collection<IndexedValue> oldValues,
                          java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<int[]> changedOutputsHolder)
        Description copied from class: FactorFunction
        Deterministically update output values in values array incrementally based on changed input values.

        For functions that support it, this can allow for more efficient computation when there are many inputs and or outputs and only a small subset of inputs have changed (e.g. one when doing a single Gibbs update).

        The default implementation delegates back to FactorFunction.evalDeterministic(Value[]), which will do a full update.

        Overrides:
        updateDeterministic in class FactorFunction
        Parameters:
        values - is the array of output and input values that are maintained persistently. When this method is called, it may be assumed that the contents contains the current values of all input variables and the last computed values of all output variables (which were based on previous values of inputs).
        oldValues - contains descriptions of the variable number and old value of each input. Only indexes of input variables should be specified. This list should not contain more than FactorFunction.updateDeterministicLimit(int) elements.
        changedOutputsHolder - should be set by the function to contains the list of indexes of output variables that were changed or else set to contain null if all of the outputs were modified.
        Returns:
        true if update was done incrementally (i.e not all inputs were processed), false if full update was done.
